00034  // Some of this code may have elements taken from other code without attribution.

00039 
00040 // We use a delay in serial_printf if the string to be printed comes withing 2/3
00041 // of the maximum buffer length. The 2/3 and the delays were determined empirically
00042 // to prevent the test code from stepping on the usart buffer. If you are certian that
00043 // you won't send serial_printf strings greater than the buffer size and that you won't
00044 // use the serial_printf to send long strings more frequently than about 20ms then you 
00045 // can remove the if() condition. We have this as the default condition for the serial
00046 // library since we assume the users are novices and might miss a note to avoid long or
00047 // frequent use of the serial_printf function.
00048 #if defined(BUTTERFLY)
00049 #include ".\butterfly\butterfly.h"
00050 #define serial_printf(val1, val2) {printf_P(PSTR(val1),val2); if(usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count() > ((2*USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN)/3)) delay(20);}
00051 #else
00052 #define serial_printf(val1, val2) {printf_P(PSTR(val1),val2); if(usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count() > ((2*USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN)/3)) delay(10);}
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #include "c:\avrtoolbox\libavr\source\driver\usart\usart0.h"
00056 
00057 #include <util\delay.h>
00058 
00059 void serial_begin(uint32_t baudrate);
00060 void serial_end(void);
00061 void serial_print(char *s);
00062 void serial_println(char *s);
00063 uint8_t serial_available(void);
00064 uint8_t serial_read(void);
00065 void serial_write(uint8_t *buff, uint8_t size);
00066 void serial_flush(void);

00068 
00069 void delay(uint16_t ms);
00070 
00071 
00072 void delay(uint16_t ms)
00073 {
00074         for(int i = 0 ; i < ms ; i++)
00075         {
00076                 _delay_ms(1);
00077         }
00078 }
00079 
00080 
00081 
00082 
00083 void serial_begin(uint32_t baud)
00084 {
00085         cli();
00086 
00087         // Modem parameters used by common serial connections
00088         usart_mode_t mode = usart_mode_asynchronous;
00089         uint8_t databits = 8;
00090         uint8_t stopbits = 1;
00091         usart_parity_t parity = parity_none;
00092         usart_flow_control_t flow_control = flow_none;
00093 
00094         usart0_init(baud, F_CPU, mode,  databits, stopbits, parity, flow_control);
00095 
00096         sei();
00097 
00098 }
00099 
00100 #define MAX_STRING 255 // stop if not a string
00101 void serial_print(char *str)
00102 {
00103 
00104         int i = 0;
00105         // Send until encountering string terminator
00106         // or exceeding MAX_STRING size in case str is not a string
00107         while( (str[i] != '\0') && ( i < MAX_STRING) )
00108         {
00109                 //loop_until_bit_is_set(UCSRA, UDRE); // wait for UDR to be clear 
00110                 //UDR = str[i++];    //send the character 
00111                 loop_until_bit_is_set(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, UART_READY_TO_TRANSMIT); // wait for UDR to be clear 
00112                 UART_DATA_REG = str[i++];    //send the character 
00113 
00114 
00115                 //usart0_transmit_buffer_insert(str[i++]);
00116         }       
00117 }
00118 
00119 void serial_println(char *str)
00120 {
00121         serial_print(str);
00122         //finish by sending a newline character
00123         //usart0_transmit_buffer_insert(0x0D);
00124         //loop_until_bit_is_set(UCSRA, UDRE); // wait for UDR to be clear 
00125         //UDR = 0x0D;    //send the character 
00126         loop_until_bit_is_set(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, UART_READY_TO_TRANSMIT); // wait for UDR to be clear 
00127         UART_DATA_REG = 0x0D;    //send the character 
00128 
00129 
00130 }
00131 
00132 uint8_t serial_available(void)
00133 {
00134         return usart0_receive_buffer_inuse_count();     
00135 }
00136 
00137 uint8_t serial_read(void)
00138 {
00139         return usart0_receive_buffer_remove();
00140 }
00141 
00142 void serial_write(uint8_t *buff, uint8_t size)
00143 {
00144         for(int i = 0; i < size; i++)
00145         {
00146                 usart0_transmit_buffer_insert(buff[i]);
00147         }
00148 }
00149 
00150 void serial_flush(void)
00151 {
00152         cli();
00153         usart0_receive_buffer_clear();
00154         usart0_transmit_buffer_clear();
00155         sei();
00156 
00157 }
00158 
00159 void serial_end(void)
00160 {
00161         usart0_uninit();
00162 }
